hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am Jimi and today we will work for around 20 minutes on resilience.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. Now, would you like to start?

Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

What did we discover about personal resources and sensations? 

What kinds of sensations came when we looked at our personal resources? 

Where in our bodies did we feel those sensations?

Do you think we could come up with more personal resources in the future? 

If you ever feel unpleasant, do you think you could use one of your personal resources to help your body feel better?”
Try out new resources and pay attention to the sensations in your body and how it feel in your mind to see if you have preferred resources.

content.text:
Well done.

You have now started to build resources that you can use any time you need to regulate your mind and body. 

If you’re up for it, you can continue with this mission.

Spend some time finding and using new resources such as a wonderful memory, a favourite place, a loved one, a joyful activity or a comforting thought.

en.name: Resourcing

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

en.description: Personal resources are internal, external, or imagined things, unique to each person, that bring about a sense of well-being, safety, or happiness when brought to present moment awareness. When we think of a personal resource (a wonderful memory, a favourite place, a loved one, a joyful activity, a comforting thought), this often brings about pleasant sensations in the body. If we then consciously attend to those sensations and give them space and time, they can deepen. This increases our nervous system’s sense of safety and brings about a greater sense of well-being and relaxation in the body.

hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Well done.

Summary.

If you’re up for it, you can continue with this mission.

mission description
